title: Is a suitable boy by Indian author Vikram Seth a boring book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Boring often refers to anything that causes a state in an individual not interested in the individual's surroundings. Thus what might be boring for me, might not be boring for you.  For instance, I enjoy reading, but my wife finds it boring. So, whether a particular thing is boring or not, depends from individual to individual.  Coming back to answer, I would recommend, you better read the book and analyze whether its boring or not.  You may go to a library / book seller and read parts of the book. You'll get your answer. By making your choices based on other's opinions, you are limiting yourself from your potential and likings....

No. It's a good book. Needs little editing and the ending is more or less predictable. But can't label it is a boring book. It talks about everything. Partition, riots, Hindu Muslim romance, love for ones children, love for parents- so it's a good wholesome book in some way. But I really adore the writing. I think that's what makes Vikram Seth a great author. Also, just so that you know- Vikram Seth is writing a sequel to it by the name- A suitable girl  Thanks!
